conversationTree.content: Thank you for acknowledging that. The last rep had me reset the device and reinstall the software. Worked for a week, then the same freezing started again. I need this to actually be fixed this time.

I've done everything - cache clearing, software reinstall, factory reset, updated firmware. Everything you could possibly suggest. The problem keeps coming back after about a week. This is clearly a deeper issue.

Overheating? No, I haven't noticed that. But honestly, I've already spent hours troubleshooting this. Can we move toward an actual solution instead of more diagnostic questions?
Good. A replacement is what should have happened after the second complaint. What's the process and how long will it take?
Escalate to technical team? I've already been through this twice. How long will that take, and what makes you think they'll find something different?

conversationTree.content: Okay, that actually sounds promising. A fix in the newer batch makes sense. Will I need to transfer all my data, or can that be done automatically?
Extended warranty is nice, but I'd rather just have a device that works properly the first time. Is there any way to expedite the shipping?
Thank you for understanding. How quickly can you get the replacement to me?
Repair? How long would a repair take? At this point, I'd rather just have a new device that works.
Okay, that's much better. 24 hours I can work with. Will this new unit actually be fixed, or is it the same model with the same defect?
3-5 days is pretty slow for someone who's already been dealing with this for weeks. Can you do any better than that?
Good decision. How soon can the replacement arrive?
2-3 days to analyze it, then what? More waiting? I've already lost weeks dealing with this. I need a faster solution.

conversationTree.content: Thank you. I really appreciate you taking this seriously and providing a real solution. This is the level of service I was hoping for from the beginning. I'll give you another chance with this replacement.
Okay, that sounds reasonable. I appreciate you working with me on this. Let's hope this replacement actually solves the problem.
Alright, I guess that will have to work. Thanks for your help, though I'm still not entirely satisfied with how long this has taken.
This is exactly the runaround I was afraid of. I think I'll be looking at competitor options while I wait. Thanks anyway.
